body_html: @danijar Assuming training_batch and testing_batch are the results of calls to tf.train.batch() that occur before the tf.cond(), it will always dequeue both batches. See here for an explanation (and substitute "dequeue operation" for "assignment").
body_text: @danijar Assuming training_batch and testing_batch are the results of calls to tf.train.batch() that occur before the tf.cond(), it will always dequeue both batches. See here for an explanation (and substitute "dequeue operation" for "assignment").
body: @danijar Assuming `training_batch` and `testing_batch` are the results of calls to `tf.train.batch()` that occur before the `tf.cond()`, it will always dequeue both batches. See [here](http://stackoverflow.com/a/37064128) for an explanation (and substitute "dequeue operation" for "assignment").
